page.title: 08CALLINGTON ROADS & RAILWAYS
page.content: The A39O & A388 roads passing through Callington are{l8C turnpikes}which have had few improvements apart from resurfacing. Several turnpike milestones still survive. One in Saltash Rd gives the distance to SALTASH PASSAGE, the old{ferry {terminal.}Another , at Bushlakes, is cut diagonally to indicate the Horsebridge road branching from the road to Tavistock. {Public transport}along these roads is infrequent. Several buses a day ply between Plymouth and Launceston but only once a week from Harrowbarrow into Callington or from Callington to Tavistock. The{railway line}closed in l965. All that remains in the block is Luckett Station, now converted to a private house.
